QAPair.Answer: With this injury, the main ligament in your thumb is stretched or torn. The ligament is a strong and flexible tissue that attaches one bone to another bone. This injury can be caused by any kind of fall with your thumb stretched out. It often occurs during skiing. At home, be sure to follow your health care provider's instructions on how to take care of your thumb so that it heals well.
